newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mixed, market seen recovering.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mixed, market seen recovering.

text.p: Croatian stocks were mixed on Tuesday as trade picked up and traders foresaw a proper market recovery.
"Prices have now stabilised after a recent dip and I expect the steady rise would continue throughout the week," Ivan Hren of Ceufin brokers told Reuters.
Of 15 active issues seven rose, five fell and three were flat. Volume rose to 9,405 units and turnover to 4.0 million kuna.
Food processor Podravka, ending a marginal 0.90 kuna higher at 317.90 kuna, took the spotlight with 4,692 shares sold.
It has been one of the most popular stocks over the past seven weeks, its price hitting 400 kuna at one point. Volume benefitted from a downward correction to the present level.
But Hren said the stock was now bound to recover, since the company managed to substitue a large part of its liabilities for cheaper foreign loans.
He added Podravka would also indirectly profit on government's protective farming policy.
Blue chip drugs firm Pliva remained flat at 480 kuna and 573 shares changed hands.

Fully listed Zagrebacka Banka lost 20 kuna to close at 1,830 on meagre volume of 51 shares. Its E-series preferred stock was more intensely traded with, gaining 10 kuna to 1,040, with 1,045 shares sold.
Hoteliers traded mixed with Laguna dipping 40 kuna to 1,400 on volume of 254 shares and Zlatni Rat gaining 90 kuna to 200 with 81 shares sold.
